nodes.name: Spatial System Definition
nodes.fol: (forall (s) (iff (spatialSystem s) (and (compositeEntity s) (exists (s1) (and (componentsOf s1 s) (forall (x) (if (member x s1)(physobj x))))) (exists (s2 s3) (and (relationsOf s2 s)(subset s3 s2) (forall (e) (if (member e s3) (exists (d x1 x2 u) (distance' e d x1 x2 u s)))))))))
nodes.english: A spatial system is a composite entity whose components are physical objects and among whose relations are distance relations between components.

nodes.name: Distance Argument Constraints
nodes.fol: (forall (d x1 x2 u s) (if (distance d x1 x2 u s) (and (nonNegInteger d)(spatialSystem s) (componentOf x1 s)(componentOf x2 s) (spatialUnit u))))
nodes.english: Distance requires a non-negative integer, two components of a spatial system, and a spatial unit.

nodes.name: Distance Reflexivity
nodes.fol: (forall (x u s) (if (and (componentOf x s)(spatialUnit u)(spatialSystem s)) (distance 0 x x u s)))
nodes.english: The distance between an entity and itself is zero.

nodes.name: Distance Symmetry
nodes.fol: (forall (d x1 x2 u s) (iff (distance d x1 x2 u s)(distance d x2 x1 u s)))
nodes.english: The distance between two entities is symmetric.

nodes.name: Triangle Inequality
nodes.fol: (forall (d1 d2 d3 d4 x1 x2 x3 u s) (if (and (distance d1 x1 x2 u s)(distance d2 x2 x3 u s) (distance d3 x1 x3 u s)(sum d4 d1 d2)) (leq d3 d4)))
nodes.english: The triangle inequality holds - the direct distance between two points is less than or equal to the sum of distances through an intermediate point.

nodes.name: Shorter Distance Definition
nodes.fol: (forall (d1 d2 s) (iff (shorterDistance d1 d2 s) (exists (u x1 x2 x3 x4) (and (distance d1 x1 x2 u s)(distance d2 x3 x4 u s) (lt d1 d2)))))
nodes.english: One distance is shorter than another in a spatial system if there exist pairs of objects such that the first distance is numerically less than the second.

nodes.name: Nearness Scale Definition
nodes.fol: (forall (s1 s) (iff (nearnessScale s1 s) (exists (u s2 s3 e d1 d2) (and (scaleDefinedBy s2 s3 e) (forall (d) (if (member d s3) (exists (x1 x2)(distance d x1 x2 u s)))) (shorterDistance' e d1 d2 s)(reverse s1 s2)))))
nodes.english: A nearness scale for a spatial system is the reverse of a scale whose elements are distances and whose ordering is shorterDistance, so shorter distances are in the Hi region.

nodes.name: Near Definition
nodes.fol: (forall (x1 x2 s) (if (and (componentOf x1 s)(componentOf x2 s)) (iff (near x1 x2 s) (exists (s1 s2 d u) (and (nearnessScale s1 s)(Hi s2 s1) (distance d x1 x2 u s)(inScale d s2))))))
nodes.english: For x1 to be near x2 is for the distance between them to be in the Hi region of a nearness scale.

nodes.name: Spatial System as Ground
nodes.english: A spatial system is a possible ground for the at relation by virtue of having physical objects as components.

nodes.name: AtLoc Definition
nodes.fol: (forall (x y s) (if (atLoc x y s) (and (spatialSystem s)(at x y s))))
nodes.english: The atLoc predicate is the at relation specialized to spatial systems.

nodes.name: Proximity Through Location
nodes.fol: (forall (s y1 y2 x1 x2) (if (and (componentOf y1 s)(componentOf y2 s) (atLoc x1 y1 s)(atLoc x2 y2 s)) (iff (near x1 x2 s)(near y1 y2 s))))
nodes.english: Two entities that are at locations in a spatial system are near if and only if their locations are near.

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
